text: Nikolai Nikolaevich Yeremenko Jr. (, (; February 14, 1949, Vitebsk, Belorussian SSR, USSR — May 27, 2001, Moscow, Russia)) was a Soviet and Russian theater and film actor, film director of Belarusian origin. He was awarded People's Artist of Russia in 1994.Почётное звание присвоено указом Президента России № 434 от 1 марта 1994 года ==Biography== Nikolai was born in Vitebsk, in the family of People's Artist of the USSR Nikolai Yeremenko Sr. (1928—2000) and People's Artist of the BSSR Galina Orlova (born 1928). In 1967, he entered the VGIK (workshop of Sergey Gerasimov and Tamara Makarova), graduated in 1971 and in the same year was admitted to the troupe of the National Film Actors' Theatre; since 1976 an actor of the Gorky Film Studio. In cinema, Nikolai Yeremenko made his debut in 1969 acting in the film By the Lake by Gerasimov. According to the results of the annual poll of viewers in the magazine Soviet Screen, Nikolai was recognized as the best actor in 1980 for the role of Sergey Sergeyevich in the film Pirates of the 20th Century. In the 1990s, Yeremenko decided on the director's debut — ', where he starred with his father. Since 2001, he was the cultural advisor of the Embassy of Belarus in Moscow.Николай Ерёменко. Биография Nikolai died in Moscow, at the Botkin Hospital, on May 27, 2001, as a result of a stroke.Умер победитель «Пиратов XX века» He was buried on May 31 in Minsk in the Eastern Cemetery, next to his father.Боец, актер, отец актера. Тяжелый путь Николая Еременко ==Personal life== He was married to Vera Titova. May 5, 1975. In this marriage, daughter Olga was born.
